intro: Thapsia garganica, commonly known as the Garganica thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Thapsia garganica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
